content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find a recipe for a cauliflower pizza crust that has a preparation time of under 30 minutes and a rating of at least 4 stars on Allrecipes. Include the number of calories per serving.  Please interact with https://www.allrecipes.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To find a specific recipe, I should utilize the search function to look for "cauliflower pizza crust" recipes. The search box appears to be element [2], and the search button is [3]. I should input my query into the search box first.
Action: Type [2]; cauliflower pizza crust
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results for "cauliflower pizza crust" are now visible, with recipes displayed in elements [9], [10], and [11]. I need to find a recipe that matches the criteria (prep time under 30 minutes and at least 4 stars rating). I should click on one of these recipe results to review its details, starting with [9], as it appears to be the basic "Cauliflower Pizza Crust" recipe which is likely to have more ratings and details.
Action: Click [9]
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The recipe "Cauliflower Pizza Crust" has a rating of 4.3 stars, meeting the requirement of at least 4 stars. Now, I need to verify the preparation time and the number of calories per serving. These details are usually found further down the recipe page. I should scroll down to find the prep time and calorie information.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The prep time, cook time, and total time information are partially visible at the bottom of this screenshot. To see the exact numbers and locate the calories per serving, I need to scroll down further.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The ingredients section is now visible. There is a button labeled "Jump to Nutrition Facts" ([11]), which likely leads directly to the section containing calorie and nutrition information. Clicking it will efficiently locate the calorie info needed to answer the task.
Action: Click [11]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The nutrition information is now visible, showing "59 Calories" per serving. Now I need to confirm that the recipe's preparation time is under 30 minutes to fully meet the task requirements. I must scroll back up to where the prep/cook/total time information is located.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am currently at the top section of the recipe, but the prep/cook/total time information is not yet visible. I need to scroll up further or locate the area just above the ingredients section to find the precise prep time.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.9
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am approaching the section with the prep/cook/total time, but it is still not visible. I need to continue scrolling up to reveal this key recipe detail.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.92
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I see that Step 6 mentions baking for about 15 minutes, which gives a clue about the cook time, but the full prep time and total time summary are still not visible. I need to continue scrolling up to find the prep/cook/total time section (usually found near the top of the recipe).
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.93
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am still within the recipe steps, with no visibility yet of the prep/cook/total time summary. The prep/cook/total time info is generally located at the very top of the recipe, so I should continue scrolling up.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.94
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am still in the step-by-step instructions section and have not yet reached the top of the recipe where the prep/cook/total time information is typically displayed. I need to continue scrolling up.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.95
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am still looking at the recipe instructions and not yet at the section with prep/cook/total time information. Continuing to scroll up is necessary to find this summary near the top of the recipe.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.96
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The view is still filled with step-by-step photos and video instructions. The prep/cook/total time summary is not yet visible; I need to continue scrolling up to reach that essential information at the top of the recipe page.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.97
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot is still displaying recipe steps and not the prep/cook/total time overview. The summary section with the required preparation time is likely closer to the top. I should continue scrolling up.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.98
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have reached the "Directions" heading, which indicates I am just below the area where the prep/cook/total time summary is typically found. One more upward scroll is likely needed to bring that information into view.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.99
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I now see the "Ingredients" section and relevant options above it, but the prep/cook/total time summary still isn't visible. This summary is typically located just above the ingredients section, so one more upward scroll should finally reveal this information.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.995
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The prep time, cook time, and additional time summary is now partially visible at the bottom—the key information area I've been seeking. I just need to scroll down a little to get the full details.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.999

content.text:
Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[0]: <button> "Main menu for Allrecipes";	[1]: "Allrecipes", "Visit Allrecipes' homepage";	[2]: <button> "Save", "Save Recipe";	[3]: <button> "Rate", "Rate It";	[4]: "Log In";	[6]: "Join for free: Use MyRecipes to save 100K+ recipes from Allrecipes and more";	[7]: <button> "Close";	[12]: "Next Up";	[13]: <button> "Jump to Nutrition Facts";	[14]: <button> "Toggle Cook Mode";	[15]: "(Keep screen awake)";	[16]: "1/2x";	[18]: "1x";	[19]: "2x";	[20]: <button> "";	[21]: "½ head cauliflower, coarsely chopped";	[22]: "½ cup shredded Italian cheese blend";

content:
Thought: The prep/cook/additional time summary is still only partially visible at the very bottom of the screenshot. Scrolling down slightly will bring the full details (including prep time) into clear view so I can confirm if it meets the "under 30 minutes" requirement.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.999
